page.title: 09Road Transport-Tamar Valley
page.content: The main road, the A390 goes though the centres of Gunnislake and St. Ann's Chapel. This main road carries traffic from Tavistock and Callington and at the weekend holiday makers travel through to the seaside resorts, making the small villages very busy. The stock which comes to the shops is transported by lorries. In the square of Gunnislake there is a bus stop for coaches from Fords Travel. Fords Travel transports approximately 900 people per week, running to Tavistock daily and to Callington weekly. Approximately 360 children are taken daily to Callington school. The railway bridge across the A390 at Gunnislake Station is too low, so British Rail is planning to move the station to the other side of the road and demolish the bridge.
